results.title: Bonjour Balwyn
results.creator_credit: Nigel Buesst and Experimental Film Fund, Australia Council for the Arts
results.brief_description: A feature film about a young man’s futile attempt to publish a trendy magazine in Carlton. When his efforts begin to fail, he must turn to petty crime to help make ends meet. Stars John Duigan and Peter Cummins.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nigel Buesst and Experimental Film Fund, Australia Council for the Arts

results.title: The Honour of Cochise
results.creator_credit: Don McDougall, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Three of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 10/8/61), the Cartwrights and a bigoted army captain who takes refuge with them are pinned down by Cochise and his braves. The Cartwrights make camp on their way home, then suddenly have to come to the defense of Army Captain, Moss Johnson, running from an Apache attack. Ben and his sons find themselves surrounded by Cochise and his people who refuse to leave without Johnson. Ben agrees to hear Cochise’s side of the story and learns that Captain Johnson called Cochise and his people together to talk of peace and used the opportunity to poison them. Adam is shot trying to get water and now Ben faces a dilemma, turn Johnson over to Cochise, or try to go for help and leave his son’s to defend him. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and Jeff Morrow.

results.title: Bonjour Paris = Hello Paris
results.creator_credit: Jean Image, Mose Sachs and Peter Sachs
results.brief_description:
Two pigeons in love are flying above Paris. They visit their friend the Eiffel Tower who is suffering from stress. Today is a celebration day in Paris and the tower would like to participate, but its large size and clumsiness only serves to create mayhem. The tower decides to go and spend some time in the country, leaving crowds of angry Parisians looking for the soul of their City. Hearing of government plans to build a new Eiffel Tower and glad to be missed so dearly, the original tower decides to reappear.

Credits: Directors, Jean Image, Mose and Peter Sachs ; writers, Eraine, Claude Santelli, Paul Colline ; photography, Kostia Tchikine ; music, Jean Yatove.
Cast: Francois Perier [voice only].

results.title: The Dark gate
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Two of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 3/4/61), Adam is puzzled by the bizarre behaviour of his longtime friend and neighbour but is powerless to help him. When Ross becomes physically violent with his wife, Adam removes her from the home to give Ross time to come to his senses. However, Ross’ behavior grows increasingly worse and he progresses to robbery and murder. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and James Coburn.

results.title: The Underdog
results.creator_credit: William F. Claxton, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
This episode from Season Six of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 13/12/64) stars Charles Bronson as a half-Comanche Harry Star, whose flight from prejudice stops at the Ponderosa when the Cartwrights mistakenly think he needs their help. Their good intentions falter when it turns out that Starr has other plans. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and Charles Bronson.

results.title: Body talking
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This engaging short film designed for Language and Visual Arts activities in grades 3 to 6 looks at a non-verbal form of communication that is universally understood - body language. With a candid camera and a catchy song, Body Talking demonstrates how our posture, gestures and facial expressions can tell others a great deal about how we’re feeling. Scenes in parks and playgrounds, on city streets and at bus stops show that “without saying a word, we can still be heard” - when our body does the talking. (Award: Vancouver)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Bombs will make the rainbows break
results.creator_credit: Barbara Zahm, Tom Hurwitz and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Presents the artwork and writings of many children from the United States and their response to fears about nuclear war. Culminates in a march and demoNstration in Washington where the children’s letters are read aloud in front of the White House.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Zahm, Tom Hurwitz and Films Incorporated

results.title: Bollywood bound
results.creator_credit: Nisha Pahuja, Karen King-Chigbo and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The world’s largest film industry centre of Bollywood has not only attracted hopeful actors from all over India, but also ethnic Indians born in other countries. This documentary follows four young Indo-Canadians as they travel to Bombay in the hope of landing roles in a Bollywood production. Raised on a diet of Hindi movies in Canada which have played a significant role in the formation of their ethnic identities, they are dismayed to find on their arrival in Bombay that despite their cultural heritage and their deep familiarity with Indian popular culture, they are deemed ‘not Indian enough’. The film blends Bollywood clips with the budding actors’ experiences in Bombay as they attempt to gain entry into the industry and discover the reality behind the fantasy of their beloved movies. In the process it offers an insight into contemporary formations of ethnic identity and the complexity of East-West cultural hybrids in the context of an increasingly globalised popular entertainment industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nisha Pahuja, Karen King-Chigbo and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Boffins. - Volume 3.
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Ever wondered why the moon stays up, or why sounds travel through the air? Boffins do. The third volume in this delightful series will entertain children from 4-7 while helping to explain the “Laws of nature.” The episodes are: “Let there be light” (reflecting light), “Feeling blue” (prisms), “Moving matters” (friction), “Miracle of life” (the importance of light, water and soil to sustain life), “The Pledge” (the ability to take charge of scientific experiments and what they really are.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia

results.title: Boffins. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, ABC Video and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Ever wonder why the moon stays up, or why sound travels through air? Boffins do. This second volume of the delightful children’s series will both entertain 4-7 year olds and help explain the “Laws of Nature.” The episodes are: “Upwards and downwards” (the force of gravity), “Life in the balance” (the centre of gravity), “Water water everywhere” (how to use a syphon), “The Disappearing water” (the evaporation of water).
